scope_alignment.description: Whether the rule is being applied within its lawful commercial/non-commercial scope.

preemption_fidelity.description: Whether state practice respects federal supremacy and preemption boundaries.

funding_integrity.description: Whether federal funding (e.g., MCSAP) is used within statutory and regulatory conditions.

rights_and_process.description: Whether application respects right to travel, due process, and equal treatment.

scope_noncommercial_treated_as_commercia.description: State is treating non-commercial citizens as if they were commercial/DOT-regulated.

preemption_conflict.description: State rule conflicts with or expands beyond federal commercial scope under 49 U.S.C./49 CFR.

preemption_field.description: State appears to legislate in a field already occupied by Congress (field preemption).

ultra_vires_enforcement.description: Agency conduct goes beyond what its enabling statutes actually authorize.

mcsap_off_mission.description: MCSAP or similar commercial enforcement funding is used for non-commercial activity.

funding_conditions_ignored.description: Practice contradicts federal funding conditions or FMCSR adoption requirements.

funding_nontransparent.description: Funding source and statutory authority are not transparent to affected people.

right_to_travel_burdened.description: Practice burdens the right to travel for people not engaged in commerce.

due_process_defects.description: Gaps in notice, hearing, or appeal before rights are restricted.

selective_application.description: Rule is applied selectively or arbitrarily across similar cases.

scoring.notes: Client-side CDA UI uses a simple sum of flag-based weights, clipped to [0,1]. That value is suitable as an input to CDI and CIRI.

doctrine_integration.notes: CDA maps each flag to one or more doctrine IDs from the doctrine map. The front-end populates doctrines_triggered based on CDA_FLAG_DOCTRINES.
